message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.CL 

The paper proposes a method for recognizing human activities in videos, which is a common problem in computer vision. The method involves learning a graph-based representation for human activities, which suggests that it falls under the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of convolutional methods (such as CNN) and non-local methods, which are commonly used in deep learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) research. The paper also evaluates its method on benchmark datasets, which suggests that it falls under the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. Finally, the paper mentions the use of natural language processing techniques (such as statistical pooling), which suggests that it may also fall under the computational linguistics (cs.CL) sub-category.
